item.description:
I'll be giving a talk on the springtime constellations for the Mass. Audubon's Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary in Topsfield on the evening of May 10th. Weather permitting, folks will get to look at the night sky through the telescopes of a local astronomy club. I will try to bring along one of my telescopes. If you would like to attend, you must preregister with the sanctuary. You can find more details here:

http://www.massaudubo...

Note that a nominal fee of $5/person is charged.

It's a great program for kids. But there is a lot for adults to take away from the experience, too. Keep in mind that the lecture part of the program runs rain, clouds, or starshine.

Again, you must contact the sanctuary if you want to attend. The phone number at the sanctuary is 978-887-9264. Their office is closed on Mondays.

If you decide to come, leave an RSVP so that I know who from the group is in the audience. I can also then send you detailed directions. Best to arrive by about 7:15 PM.

You'll enjoy it, though I am a bit biased.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the sanctuary barn.
item.why: Because you love the night sky.
item.name: Astronomy Lecture and Stargazing
